meanings.definition: A device that combines several signals for transmission over a single channel.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexers in the control room help send many messages through one wire.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed multiplexers to merge different signals into one stream.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexers at the party mixed all the music tracks into one big dance mix.
meanings.sent4: Her brain worked like multiplexers, blending thoughts into a single focused idea.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexers acted like traffic cops, directing various signals down one lane.

meanings.definition: A device that selects one of several input signals and forwards it to a single output.
meanings.sent1: The multiplexers at the switchboard choose which call to connect to the operator.
meanings.sent2: In the studio, the multiplexers decide which camera feed goes live on air.
meanings.sent3: The multiplexers in the game console pick the best graphics for display.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like multiplexers, filtering out distractions to focus on one task.
meanings.sent5: The multiplexers acted as gatekeepers, allowing only one signal to pass through at a time.
